Description: Pair of hemispherical gold ball earrings with S-shaped hooks: earrings of the standard gold ball-and-disc type. The ball elements, forming less than a hemisphere, are made of two sections with a very neat vertical join. At the back they are finished with a flange 4 mm wide. A vertical supporting wire is attached at the back of the ball, and the end of the recurved hook is coiled around the end of it; the hook then runs up the back of the domed disc, about 9 mm in diameter, which is attached to the top of the ball. The join is concealed by a row of four gold grains.
Curator's comments: A very similar construction may be seen on an earring in Mainz (Deppert-Lippitz, 'Goldschmuck der Römerzeit im Römisch-Germanischen Zentralmuseum' (1985), no. 48, Taf. 19). Bibliography: F. H. Marshall, 'Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum' 1911, nos 2618, 2619; K. Parlasca & H. Seeman, ‘Augenblicke, Mumienporträts un ägyptische Grabkunst aus römischer Zeit’ (1999), 246 no. 152.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2618)
Walker, S 2000 / Ancient Faces: Mummy Portraits from Roman Egypt (100)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2015, Oct 29 – 2016, Feb 7. British Museum, Room 35. Egypt: Faith after the Pharaohs 2019-2020, 27 Jul-16 Feb, Colchester, Colchester Castle, Essex Bling
